thread.title: Shiv Ashish school boys, girls win kabaddi league
thread.title_full: Shiv Ashish school boys, girls win kabaddi league - The Times of India

author: Shweta Singh
title: Shiv Ashish school boys, girls win kabaddi league
text:
AHMEDABAD: The ancient Indian sport kabaddi has caught the nation's attention in the form of the Pro Kabaddi League (PKL). Though no franchisee belongs to Gujarat, the popularity of the sport can be seen in the first inter-school kabaddi league hosted by Gems Genesis International School in the city on Friday evening. The presence of PKL's champion team U Mumba's skipper Anup Kumar at the event was like adding cherry to the cake.
In the competition it was Shiv Ashish School which bagged both the boys and girls titles. The boys team thrashed Sri Sri Ravi Shankar Vidyamandir School 34-13 and the girls scored a facile 24-7win over Sri Ram Vidyalaya girls.
A total of eight boys and five girls' team of Grade 1 to 4 from eight schools of Ahmedabad took part in the 10-a-side knockout matches. The teams were Jamnabai Narsee School, South West High School, Shiv Ashish School, Aavishkar International School, Tripada International School, Gems Genesis International School, Sri Sri Ravi Shankar Vidya Mandir and Sri Ram Vidyalaya.
